title: 112_hr6206
content: The "Build America Bonds Act of 2012" establishes Build America Bonds permanently. The Build America Bonds Act of 2012 makes Build America Bonds permanent and adjusts the credit percentage to bondholders. The Build America Bonds Act of 2012 made Build America Bonds permanent and adjusted the credit percentage to bondholders based on the year of issuance. The Build America Bonds Act of 2012 amended certain sections of the Internal Revenue Code, including adjustments to the credit percentage for bondholders and the period of issuance eligibility. The Build America Bonds Act of 2012 made changes to the Internal Revenue Code, including adjusting the credit percentage for bondholders and the period of issuance eligibility. The Secretary will determine the applicable percentage according to a specified table. The applicable percentage for qualified bonds issued during specific calendar years ranges from 35% in 2009 or 2010 to 28% in 2016 and thereafter. Current refundings are permitted for qualified bonds under certain conditions. The applicable percentage for qualified bonds issued ranges from 35% in 2009 or 2010 to 28% in 2016 and thereafter. Current refundings are allowed under specific conditions, including the maturity date alignment, amount limitations, and timely redemption of refunded bonds. The amendments made by this section apply to obligations issued on or after the date of the enactment of this Act, including clarification related to levees and flood control projects. SEC. 3. LIMITATION ON SECTION 199 DEDUCTION ATTRIBUTABLE TO OIL, NATURAL GAS, OR PRIMARY PRODUCTS THEREOF. The amendment limits the deduction for certain oil and gas income for major integrated oil companies, excluding gross receipts from oil, gas, or primary products. Effective for taxable years after enactment.
